etymologies: Old English ǣl, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch aal and German Aal

definitions: a snake-like fish with a slender elongated body and poorly developed fins, proverbial for its slipperiness.

notes.text: Order Anguilliformes: many families, in particular Anguillidae, which comprises mainly freshwater eels that breed in the sea, including the common Anguilla anguilla of Europe and the American eel (A. rostrata)

shortDefinitions: snake-like fish with slender elongated body

definitions: used in names of unrelated fishes that resemble the true eels, e.g. electric eel, moray eel.
shortDefinitions: used in names of unrelated fishes that resemble true eels
